title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: Welcome atctools package vignette! vignette provides overview package functionality, demonstrates usage key functions, explains example datasets included.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: atctools package provides tools ATC (Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical) code matching data integrity checks drug names. includes functions matching drug names ATC codes without stripping trailing characters, well validating ATC codes. atctools package comprises: drug_match: Matches drug names ATC codes without stripping trailing characters. drug_match_strip: Matches drug names ATC codes, stripping trailing characters “mg”, “g”, etc. atc2drug: Matches ATC codes drug names. validate_atc: Validates whether ATC codes follow correct format (length structure). validate_atc_by_reference: Validates ATC codes checking reference list known codes. example_drug_data: Drug names without milligrams. example_drug_data_with_mg: Drug names including milligrams. example_reference_data: Reference data ATC codes corresponding drug names. example_atc_data: ATC codes testing atc2drug function, including valid, non-valid, NA values. example_atc_data_for_validation: ATC codes mix valid, invalid, unknown codes testing validation functions.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset contains example drug names without milligrams.
code: example_drug_data #>       drug_name #> 1       Aspirin #> 2   Paracetamol #> 3     Ibuprofen #> 4    Cetirizine #> 5    Lisinopril #> 6     Metformin #> 7  Atorvastatin #> 8    Omeprazole #> 9    Salbutamol #> 10  Amoxicillin

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset contains example drug names including milligrams.
code: example_drug_data_with_mg #>            drug_name #> 1      Aspirin 100mg #> 2  Paracetamol 500mg #> 3    Ibuprofen 200mg #> 4    Cetirizine 10mg #> 5    Lisinopril 20mg #> 6   Metformin 1000mg #> 7  Atorvastatin 40mg #> 8    Omeprazole 20mg #> 9     Salbutamol 2mg #> 10 Amoxicillin 500mg

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset reference dataset containing example drug names corresponding ATC codes drug matching. Please ensure : first column (example: drug_name) contains drug names. second column (example: ATC_code) contains ATC codes.
code: example_reference_data #>       drug_name ATC_code #> 1       aspirin  B01AC06 #> 2   paracetamol  N02BE01 #> 3     ibuprofen  M01AE01 #> 4    cetirizine  R06AE07 #> 5    lisinopril  C09AA03 #> 6     metformin  A10BA02 #> 7  atorvastatin  C10AA05 #> 8    omeprazole  A02BC01 #> 9    salbutamol  R03AC02 #> 10  amoxicillin  J01CA04

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset provides example ATC codes testing atc2drug function. includes valid ATC codes, non-valid codes, NA values demonstrate function handles different types input.
code: example_atc_data #>     ATC_code #> 1    B01AC06 #> 2    N02BE01 #> 3       <NA> #> 4    M01AE01 #> 5    R06AE07 #> 6 ABCDE12345 #> 7 abcde12345 #> 8       <NA>

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset contains mix valid, invalid, unknown ATC codes across two columns (atc_1, atc_2) testing validation functions.
code: example_atc_data_for_validation #>   ID   atc_1   atc_2 #> 1  1 B01AC06 C10AA05 #> 2  2 N02BE01 M01AE01 #> 3  3  FAKETC NOPE123 #> 4  4 WRONG01 XXXXX01 #> 5  5 Z99ZZ99 J01CA04

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: validate_atc() function checks whether ATC code specified column format-valid based official ATC code structure. adds new column (e.g., atc_1_invalid) next specified column indicating whether code invalid (1) valid (0). ATC codes must either 5 7 characters long follow expected letter-number-letter-letter-number-number structure (7-character codes).
code: # Validate ATC codes by format validate_output <- validate_atc(example_atc_data_for_validation, "atc_1")  # View result validate_output #>   ID   atc_1 atc_1_invalid   atc_2 #> 1  1 B01AC06             0 C10AA05 #> 2  2 N02BE01             0 M01AE01 #> 3  3  FAKETC             1 NOPE123 #> 4  4 WRONG01             1 XXXXX01 #> 5  5 Z99ZZ99             0 J01CA04

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: validate_atc_with_reference() function checks ATC code specified column exists reference list valid codes (e.g., example_reference_data). useful ensuring codes just structurally valid also known accepted.
code: # Validate ATC codes against a reference list valid_codes <- example_reference_data$ATC_code validate_by_ref_output <- validate_atc_with_reference(example_atc_data_for_validation, "atc_2", valid_codes)  # View result validate_by_ref_output #>   ID   atc_1   atc_2 atc_2_invalid #> 1  1 B01AC06 C10AA05             0 #> 2  2 N02BE01 M01AE01             0 #> 3  3  FAKETC NOPE123             1 #> 4  4 WRONG01 XXXXX01             1 #> 5  5 Z99ZZ99 J01CA04             0

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: ’s might run validation functions sequence examine combined results: flags: atc_1_invalid: Format-based invalidity atc_2_invalid: found reference list
code: valid_codes <- example_reference_data$ATC_code output_combined <- example_atc_data_for_validation %>%   validate_atc("atc_1") %>%   validate_atc_with_reference("atc_2", valid_codes)  output_combined #>   ID   atc_1 atc_1_invalid   atc_2 atc_2_invalid #> 1  1 B01AC06             0 C10AA05             0 #> 2  2 N02BE01             0 M01AE01             0 #> 3  3  FAKETC             1 NOPE123             1 #> 4  4 WRONG01             1 XXXXX01             1 #> 5  5 Z99ZZ99             0 J01CA04             0

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_match function matches drug names dataset corresponding ATC codes using reference dataset. strip trailing characters drug names. Usage:
code: library(atctools)  # Perform drug matching output_data1 <- drug_match(example_drug_data, "drug_name", example_reference_data)  # Display output data output_data1 #>       drug_name drug_name_original drug_name_matched drug_name_flag #> 1       Aspirin            aspirin           aspirin              0 #> 2   Paracetamol        paracetamol       paracetamol              0 #> 3     Ibuprofen          ibuprofen         ibuprofen              0 #> 4    Cetirizine         cetirizine        cetirizine              0 #> 5    Lisinopril         lisinopril        lisinopril              0 #> 6     Metformin          metformin         metformin              0 #> 7  Atorvastatin       atorvastatin      atorvastatin              0 #> 8    Omeprazole         omeprazole        omeprazole              0 #> 9    Salbutamol         salbutamol        salbutamol              0 #> 10  Amoxicillin        amoxicillin       amoxicillin              0 #>    drug_name_ATC #> 1        B01AC06 #> 2        N02BE01 #> 3        M01AE01 #> 4        R06AE07 #> 5        C09AA03 #> 6        A10BA02 #> 7        C10AA05 #> 8        A02BC01 #> 9        R03AC02 #> 10       J01CA04

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_match_strip function matches drug names dataset corresponding ATC codes, stripping trailing characters (e.g., “mg”, “g”) drug names matching. Usage:
code: # Perform drug matching with trailing characters stripped output_data2 <- drug_match_strip(example_drug_data_with_mg, "drug_name", example_reference_data)  # Display output data output_data2 #>            drug_name drug_name_stripped drug_name_matched drug_name_flag #> 1      Aspirin 100mg            aspirin           aspirin              0 #> 2  Paracetamol 500mg        paracetamol       paracetamol              0 #> 3    Ibuprofen 200mg          ibuprofen         ibuprofen              0 #> 4    Cetirizine 10mg         cetirizine        cetirizine              0 #> 5    Lisinopril 20mg         lisinopril        lisinopril              0 #> 6   Metformin 1000mg          metformin         metformin              0 #> 7  Atorvastatin 40mg       atorvastatin      atorvastatin              0 #> 8    Omeprazole 20mg         omeprazole        omeprazole              0 #> 9     Salbutamol 2mg         salbutamol        salbutamol              0 #> 10 Amoxicillin 500mg        amoxicillin       amoxicillin              0 #>    drug_name_ATC #> 1        B01AC06 #> 2        N02BE01 #> 3        M01AE01 #> 4        R06AE07 #> 5        C09AA03 #> 6        A10BA02 #> 7        C10AA05 #> 8        A02BC01 #> 9        R03AC02 #> 10       J01CA04

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: atc2drug function matches ATC codes drug names based reference dataset. handles valid ATC codes, ignores invalid ATC codes, returns NA non-matching codes. Usage:
code: # Perform ATC code to drug name matching output_data3 <- atc2drug(example_atc_data, "ATC_code", example_reference_data)  # Display output data output_data3 #>     ATC_code ATC_code_drug #> 1    B01AC06       aspirin #> 2    N02BE01   paracetamol #> 3       <NA>          <NA> #> 4    M01AE01     ibuprofen #> 5    R06AE07    cetirizine #> 6 ABCDE12345          <NA> #> 7 abcde12345          <NA> #> 8       <NA>          <NA>

what: Flag Meaning in the Output Data of example_drug_data and example_drug_data_with_mg
title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_name_flag column output dataset indicates whether prefix mismatch drug name matched ATC code. 1: Indicates mismatch first three characters drug name match first three characters ATC code. 0: Indicates match first three characters drug name match first three characters ATC code.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: vignette provides overview use atctools package drug name matching understanding flag column output. details function additional functionality, refer package documentation examples.

what: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: atctools R package designed facilitating Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) matching ensuring integrity ATC data pharmaceutical datasets.

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: ATC Matching: Functions match drug names ATC codes using methods Levenshtein distance. ATC Code Matching: Functions match ATC codes drug names directly. ATC Data Integrity Checks: Tools verify structure validity ATC codes using reference list.

previous_headings: Example Usage of ATC Matching Functions
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: Matches drug names ATC codes without stripping trailing characters like “mg”, “g”, etc.
code: library(atctools)  output_data <- drug_match(example_drug_data, "drug_name", example_reference_data) output_data

previous_headings: Example Usage of ATC Matching Functions
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: Matches drug names ATC codes trailing characters stripped.
code: output_data_stripped <- drug_match_strip(example_drug_data_with_mg, "drug_name", example_reference_data) output_data_stripped

previous_headings: Example Usage of ATC Matching Functions
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: Matches ATC codes back drug names directly (fuzzy matching).
code: output_data_atc2drug <- atc2drug(example_atc_data, "ATC_code", example_reference_data) output_data_atc2drug

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: Checks ATC codes follow correct structural format (length, character pattern).
code: validate_output <- validate_atc(example_atc_data_for_validation, "atc_1") validate_output

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: Checks ATC codes exist given reference list (e.g., ATC index validated dataset).
code: validate_by_ref_output <- validate_atc_by_reference(example_atc_data_for_validation, "atc_2", example_reference_data) validate_by_ref_output

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: atc_1_invalid: Flag invalid format (1 = invalid, 0 = valid) atc_2_invalid: Flag “found reference list” (1 = found, 0 = found)
code: output_combined <- example_atc_data_for_validation %>%   validate_atc("atc_1") %>%   validate_atc_by_reference("atc_2", example_reference_data)  output_combined

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: drug_name_flag column appears outputs drug_match() drug_match_strip(). 0: First 3 characters drug name match first 3 matched ATC code. 1: Mismatch detected drug name ATC prefix.

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: Install development version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("vljlangen/atctools")

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: ✅ New validation functions: validate_atc() checks format validity. validate_atc_by_reference() checks presence reference data. 🧪 New dataset: example_atc_data_for_validation support validation testing. 🔁 Updated function examples documentation include validation workflow. 🧹 Minor improvements atc2drug() better column detection.

what: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
text: function matches ATC codes input data frame corresponding drug names using reference data frame.  reference data frame must drug names first column ATC codes second column.

title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
code: atc2drug(input_data, atc_column, reference_data)

title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
text: input_data data frame containing column ATC codes matched. atc_column name column input_data containing ATC codes. reference_data data frame drug names first column corresponding ATC codes second column.

title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
text: modified data frame additional column: atc_code_drug Drug name matched ATC code.

title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
code: # Example usage: data(example_atc_data) data(example_reference_data) atc2drug(example_atc_data, "ATC_code", example_reference_data) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union #>     ATC_code ATC_code_drug #> 1    B01AC06       aspirin #> 2    N02BE01   paracetamol #> 3       <NA>          <NA> #> 4    M01AE01     ibuprofen #> 5    R06AE07    cetirizine #> 6 ABCDE12345          <NA> #> 7 abcde12345          <NA> #> 8       <NA>          <NA>

what: ATC Code Validation for a Single Column — validate_atc
title: ATC Code Validation for a Single Column — validate_atc
text: function validates ATC code specified column data frame. checks structure length ATC code, ensuring follows standard format (5 7 characters long) returns additional column indicating whether code valid (0) invalid (1).

code: validate_atc(input_data, atc_column)

title: ATC Code Validation for a Single Column — validate_atc
text: input_data data frame containing ATC code column validated. atc_column name column input_data containing ATC codes.

title: ATC Code Validation for a Single Column — validate_atc
text: modified data frame additional column: atc_column_invalid Flag indicating whether ATC code valid (0) invalid (1).

title: ATC Code Validation for a Single Column — validate_atc
code: # Example usage: data(example_atc_data_for_validation) validate_atc(example_atc_data_for_validation, "atc_1") #>   ID   atc_1 atc_1_invalid   atc_2 #> 1  1 B01AC06             0 C10AA05 #> 2  2 N02BE01             0 M01AE01 #> 3  3  FAKETC             1 NOPE123 #> 4  4 WRONG01             1 XXXXX01 #> 5  5 Z99ZZ99             0 J01CA04

title: Validate ATC Codes Against a Reference List — validate_atc_with_reference

title: Validate ATC Codes Against a Reference List — validate_atc_with_reference
code: data(example_atc_data_for_validation) data(example_reference_data)  valid_codes <- example_reference_data$ATC_code validate_atc_with_reference(example_atc_data_for_validation, "atc_1", valid_codes) #>   ID   atc_1 atc_1_invalid   atc_2 #> 1  1 B01AC06             0 C10AA05 #> 2  2 N02BE01             0 M01AE01 #> 3  3  FAKETC             1 NOPE123 #> 4  4 WRONG01             1 XXXXX01 #> 5  5 Z99ZZ99             1 J01CA04 validate_atc_with_reference(example_atc_data_for_validation, "atc_2", valid_codes) #>   ID   atc_1   atc_2 atc_2_invalid #> 1  1 B01AC06 C10AA05             0 #> 2  2 N02BE01 M01AE01             0 #> 3  3  FAKETC NOPE123             1 #> 4  4 WRONG01 XXXXX01             1 #> 5  5 Z99ZZ99 J01CA04             0
